main event: On January 21, 1951, a series of UFO sightings were reported over Oak Ridge, Tennessee, including ground radar observations and visual sightings by pilots and navigators.
interesting points: The UFO was initially thought to be a stationary aircraft but was later determined to be an unknown target with characteristics that couldn't be identified.
Multiple radar sightings were made of an unidentified object, with one report indicating that it made an abrupt 90-degree turn before disappearing.
A document suggested that the radar target detected was highly probable to be a ground target near the Y-12 plant and was identified as such.
The atmospheric conditions at the time, including inversion layers, were considered as a possible cause for the detection of a ground target as airborne by the interceptor.
The lack of factual evidence and the peculiar phenomena observed led to no positive explanation being offered for the visual sightings of the UFO.
witnesses: civilian, ground radar observers, pilots, navigator
photographs: No, the report does not include photographs
